editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: ANSELM, AUGUSTINE; S. XIV in., XIV ex.

msItem.p: fols. i-ii, 149–50, are two bifolia, not contiguous, from the same copy of AVICENNA, Canon Medicinae, s. xiv. The first is the outermost of the original quire, bound inside-out, as the catchword is on fol. iv. On fol. iirv are the prologue and capitula, beg. ‘In primis Deo gratias agemus sicut sui ordinis celsitudo et beneficii ipsius multitudo meretur ...’. eTK 0705F. In the margin of fol. ii is a table of contents, s. xiv ex. Written space 285 × 160 mm., ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 74 lines; written in a formal English gothic rotunda bookhand. Decoration lacks.

physDesc.p: Two originally separate volumes, together soon after the making of II.

supportDesc.extent:
152 leaves (ii + 150) 360 225
275 165
The edges retrimmed with loss of marginalia and spattered red.
supportDesc.collation: a bifolium at each end, 1–1212, 136(5–6 canc.); I has pencilled quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form and catchwords with decorative frames. II has pencilled leaf numbers and framed catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 57 lines.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. An earlier binding had two straps and clasps. Parchment cut from the lower edge of fols. 149–50 has probably removed traces of the large chain-staple.

history.provenance: At the foot of fol. i is pencilled ‘Wucstone’, s. xiv, perhaps Master Geoffrey de Wocstone (BRUO 2068), who figured in a legal dispute settled at Oxford in 1354.
At the head of fol. iv is ‘Liber Roberti Myddelond’’, s. xiv. Robert Myddelonde (BRUO 1274) was fellow of Merton 1330–47, canon in four cathedrals simultaneously, d. by Sept. 1367.

At the head of fol. iiv, cropped, ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton ex dono Magistri Roberti Wyght anno Domini M. CCCC. LXVIII incathenatus.’ This is repeated inside the front board in a hand of s. xvii, with the addition of the words ‘quondam socii’. Whyte (BRUO 2042–3) was fellow c. 1424, no longer in 1433, d. 1461. Appendix B no. 113 (1460–1) records a payment ‘pro uectura librorum Magistri Roberti Wyght legatorum collegii per eundem’.

At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘231’, s. xvii in., wrongly, for this should be MS 45. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with the contents and ‘N. 2. 8. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘B. 2. 8 (XX)’, in red ink. The College bookplate. ‘8’ is inked on the foredge

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Monologion
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola Anselmi archiepiscopi ad Lanfrancum primatem Anglie
msItem.incipit: Reuerendo et amando suo domino
msItem.rubric: Incipit prohemium beati Anselmi archiepiscopi in monologion R.
msItem.incipit: Quidam fratres sepe me studioseque
Si quis unam naturam summam omnique que sunt

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Incarnatione Verbi
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola de incarnacione uerbi Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi. Prefacio
msItem.incipit: Domino et patri uniuerse ecclesie in terra peregrinantis
Dicit sicud audio ille qui tres personas dicitur asserere esse

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Conceptu Virginali
msItem.incipit: Cum in omnibus religiose tue uoluntatis uelim
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Anselmi Cantuar’ archiepiscopi de conceptu uirginali et de originali peccato

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Processione Spiritus Sancti
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber eiusdem de processione Spiritus Sancti
msItem.incipit: Negatur a Grecis quod Spiritus Sanctus de Filio procedat
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Anselmi de processione Spiritus Sancti

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Epistola de Sacrificio Azymi et Fermentati
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola eiusdem de sacramentis ecclesie. Prefacio.
msItem.incipit: Anselmus seruus ecclesie Cantuariensis Waleranno Nuenburgensi episcopo.
Scienti breuiter loquor

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Sacramentis Ecclesiae
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola beati Anselmi de sacramentis ecclesie
msItem.incipit: Domino et amico Uualeranno gratia Dei Nuenburgensi uenerabili episcopo Anselmus
Gaudeo et gratias Domino

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Concordia Praescientiae et Praedestinationis
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Anselmi Cantuarie archiepiscopi de concordia presciencie et predestinacionis et gratie Dei cum libero arbitrio
msItem.incipit: De tribus illis questionibus in quibus Dei prescientie
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de grammatico et libero arbitrio

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Grammatico
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de grammatico
msItem.incipit: Discipulus. De grammatico peto ut me certum facias

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Veritate
msItem.rubric: Incipit prefacio Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi in subditum opus scilicet in tres tractatus
msItem.incipit: Tres tractatus pertinentes ad studium sacre scripture
Quoniam Deum esse ueritatem credimus

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Libertate Arbitrii
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula in tractatu de libertate arbitrii
msItem.incipit: Quoniam liberum arbitrium uidetur repugnare gratie
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de libertate arbitrii editus ab Anselmo Cantuariensi archiepiscopo

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Cur Deus Homo
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in librum Anselmis Cur Deus homo
msItem.incipit: Opus subditum propter quosdam
Sepe et studiosissime a multis rogatus

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: De Casu Diaboli
msItem.incipit: Quod etiam ad angelos dicatur quid habes quod non accepisti
Illud apostoli quid habes quod non accepisti

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Proslogion
msItem.rubric: Incipit prohemium in prosologion Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi
msItem.incipit: Postquam opusculum quoddam uelut exemplum meditandi
Eya nunc homuncio
msItem.explicit: donec intrem in gaudium Domini mei, qui ...

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Epist. 204
msItem.incipit: Anselmus gratia Dei archiepiscopus domino priori Bernardo et aliis fratribus in cenobio Sancti Albani conuersantibus salutem et benediccionem. Fratres ad me auram dileccione
msItem.explicit: unus et non unum. Valete et orate pro me

msItem.title: De Similitudinibus
msItem.incipit: Voluntas tripliciter intelligitur
msItem.explicit: ne nobis noceant in quam uolunt
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de similitudinibus uenerabilis Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi

msItem.author: Eadmer
msItem.title: De Excellentia Beatae Virginis
msItem.rubric: De eminencia beate uirginis
msItem.incipit: Supereminentem omni quod post hominem

msItem.author: Eadmer
msItem.title: De Conceptione Beatae Virginis
msItem.rubric: Incipit Anselmi tractatus de concepcione beate Virginis
msItem.incipit: Principium quo salus mundo possit mihi considerare

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Contra Insipientem
msItem.rubric: Tractatus Anselmi Cantuariensis archiepiscopi contra insipientem uel melius contra incipientis ad predicta
msItem.incipit: Dubitanti utrum sic uel neganti quod sit
Quoniam non me reprehendit in hiis dictis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Anselmi contra insipientem. Explicit liber.

handDesc.handNote: Several English gothic rotunda bookhands, influenced, in varying degrees, by anglicana. The scribe of fols. 1–48 lengthens and ornaments his ascenders on the top line.

decoDesc.decoNote: red and blue flourished initials; plain red or blue initials (perhaps intended for flourishing in the other colour); occasional blue initials flourished in red. Red highlighting, paraphs and underlining.

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: Enchiridion
msItem.incipit: Dici non potest dilectissime fili Laurenti
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit encheridion sancti Augustini ad Laurencium de fide spe et caritate

msItem.author: FULGENTIUS
msItem.title: De Fide ad Petrum
msItem.rubric: Et incipit liber Agustini de fide ad Petrum
msItem.incipit: Epistolam filii Petre tue caritatis accepi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber beati Augustini de fide ad Petrum

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: Dialogus Quaestionum LXV
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt questiones Orosii ad sanctum Augustinum
msItem.incipit: Licet multi ac probatissimi uiri

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Disciplina Christiana
msItem.rubric: Augustinus de disciplina Christianorum
msItem.incipit: Locutus est ad uos sermo Dei

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: Serm. app. 252
msItem.rubric: Incipit ammonitio beati Augustini ut non solum lingua sed moribus et opere laudetur Deus quia quale est quod cogitatur in corde tale quod procedit in ore
msItem.incipit: Resurrectio et clarificatio Domini nostri

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Creatione Primi Hominis
msItem.rubric: Liber beati Augustini qualiter homo factus est ad ymaginem et similitudinem Dei
msItem.incipit: Quanta dignitas humane condicionis
msItem.note: PL 40. 1213–14. The common excerpt from De Spiritu et Anima.

msItem.author: Ps.-AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Duodecim Abusionibus Saeculi
msItem.rubric: De duodecim abusionibus
msItem.incipit: Primo si sine operibus bonis

msItem.author: AUGUSTINE
msItem.title: De Gratia et Libero Arbitrio
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de gratia et libero arbitrio
msItem.incipit: Propter eos qui liberum arbitrium hominis sic predicant
msItem.explicit: et gloria et regnum cum Patre ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber de gratia Dei et libero arbitrio

msItem.note: On fol. 148v is a table of contents, s. xv, using the foliation.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 149 is a 6-line initial D, red and blue, flourished in red and violet; red initials flourished in violet, blue initials flourished in red. Red highlighting, paraphs and underlining; yellow highlighting.
